intro: Paratropia samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the island of Samoa in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with large, spirally arranged leaves and showy yellow flowers. Its fruit, resembling a starfruit, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. Paratropia samoensis plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental and culinary uses.
